intro: Veronica pulchra, commonly known as the beauty flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Veronica pulchra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance.
